caption: A beautiful memorial to brave young adventurers who came to help.  It's in a beautiful under rated park near Paris and accessible by RER. An idÃ©al monument to aim for on a picnic/ hiking day.

The memorial is located in a great place. Easy to reach from Paris by train or car. Or ride a bike from Saint Cloud. Also there is a visitor centre, small but it is very informative. The people at the memorial are super helpful. A great way to learn about the squadron and the US pilots that fought for France during WWI under the French colours.
Memorial dedicated to American fighter pilots who volunteered to fight for France during WWI.
Beautiful memorial with an important story behind it. The guide, Corentin Molusson, was great - engaging, funny and knowledgeable
The memorial is located in a great place. Easy to reach from Paris by train or car.
prideful and detailed memorial, high quality construction. Is kept clean and accessible for all.
Beautiful memorial in exquisite surroundings. We were there for a formal event and it was very moving.
Beautifully well kept grounds.  Wonderful carvings. Peaceful memorial.
Very pretty monument especially at dusk or dawn
Thx to those who have fight  for us and gave their life Ã‰ternel respect et reconnaissance us glory
Beautiful
It is very sad to see the names of the young men and places that they fought at.
Beautiful monument

Very beautiful place... The monument is very beautiful and very well maintained, whether it is itself or the park around it. The surrounding park is adjacent to the St Cloud park and frankly it is a pleasure to cross it. It's a peaceful place that you can cross by bike, running or walking, the only thing is to respect it and not do anything and respect the paths.
Beautiful memorial monument in the middle of the park. Peaceful.

Since this place of memory has been taken over, restored and brought to life (despite it being a mausoleum), the visit has become essential. The staff is very pleasant and very knowledgeable about the monument, the period and the life (and death, for some) of these heroic pioneers of war aviation. Glory to them, and thank you.

Superb, passionate and fascinating guide who revealed to us the secrets of the architecture and details to see but above all who made us experience the very strong moments of these young men of the LA FAYETTE squadron Died for the homeland. Free visit to see and review. Thank you very much to our guide. Carole
We visited with the children, and beyond the clear and passionate explanations of our guide, we appreciated the discovery of this squadron which is little-known. I highly recommend

The Memorial and its lawn are very well maintained. Close to a lake and a forest, it is a pleasant place to walk and picnic. Itâ€™s a shame that the noise from the traffic spoils the tranquility of this relatively uncrowded place.
Very beautiful memorial. I was invited there during the centenary ceremony of the Escadrille La Fayette, which was grandiose.
Part of the St Cloud park, clean and beautiful, currently undergoing facade renovation (getting a makeover).
Very beautiful monument in honor of the Lafayette Escadrille.
Very well maintained memorial site. Very good visit to make.
A thought for all those young Anglo-Saxon people who gave their lives for France in 1918. This monument is dedicated to them.
Very beautiful monument, calm and pleasant park
A little-known park and therefore peaceful and yet so wonderful. I love it ðŸ˜Š â€¦
Very beautiful memorial with a very interesting little museum in the visitor center where the guide presents the history of the squadron, all in a beautiful peaceful park.

We were very surprised by this magnificent, little-known visit. Indeed, the very professional guide explained to us what the Fayette memorial squadron was with notes of fairly light anecdotes to guide us and teach us a lot about this monument so well maintained by the American government. Thank you Corentin!
Very beautiful memorial in the magnificent Saint Cloud park.
A piece of history to discover. Exciting and free guide

Family visit to this majestic place steeped in history... The setting is splendid. We had a guided tour of the Memorial and the crypt. Our guide was perfect, interesting and gave us lots of historical anecdotes. The place is very moving. We highly recommend.
The La Fayette squadron memorial is a very beautiful monument
very beautiful monument in a small little-known park
Superb visit with a passionate guide who brought to life the epic story of these Americans who came to be killed in France in the name of freedom. The site is magnificent. Thanks again to our guide.

The imposing monument, the space around it is well-kept, fresh lawn. The park where it is located is quite beautiful. I was now, when nature is sad, I think that in another season it is much better. Nearby is the recently renovated small museum, where you can find information about the Lafayette squadron, a model of a fighter plane from the First World War. It's impressive that the plane looks so rudimentary (compared to what we have now) and yet soldiers were flying it and bombing or shooting with it. A blond young man from the museum explained very nicely how this flight was made and how it was fired in battle. We also see a mannequin in military uniform, medals, information, plaques, models. Everything in a beautiful, clean, neat setting.

This morning we went to visit the Lafayette Escadrille memorial. This monument deserves to be known. It pays tribute to the American volunteer aviators who signed up to help France even though the United States had not entered the war in 1914. A guided tour with Corentin was extremely interesting, we learned the history of these heroes in starting with the museum then the guided tour of the crypt. Thank you for the friendly welcome

Once the moment of surprise passed, emotion took over. Our guide captivated us by recounting this little-known story. We thank her warmly. And we recommend visiting this site. As a bonus, the setting of the magnificent Saint-Cloud park.

very beautiful monument with small museum very beautiful lawn for resting clean quiet place too bad the dogs are all free on the lawn, very unpleasant when you are picnicking  the owners do not respect the rules from st cloud park always the same owner if walked every day with big dogs lack of control my child stole his cakes on Sunday
